intro: Parodia microsperma var. lembckei, commonly known as the Lembcke’s prickly pear, is a succulent cactus native to southern Africa. It features a compact, globular stem covered in white to pale green spines. The plant produces yellow flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. Its leaves are reduced to spines, and it is well adapted to arid environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and resilience in dry climates.
